data.title: Marc Anthony coy on Today show about reported marriage to J-Lo
data.meta_description: Singer Marc Anthony wasn't letting the cat out of the bag on whether he and Jennifer Lopez got married over the weekend.
data.text:
(New York City) June 8, 2004 - Singer Marc Anthony wasn't letting the cat out of the bag on whether he and Jennifer Lopez got married over the weekend.

Anthony was grilled by the Today Show's Matt Lauer before he performed on the show Tuesday morning. When Matt asked him if he and Lopez tied the knot, he refused to answer, saying he doesn't talk about his personal life.

Lauer asked, "Will you confirm for me?" to which the entertainer replied, "I see where you're going with this, and I'm just going to preface it with just saying ... I don't talk about my personal life."

Lauer then directly asked, "Did you marry Jennifer over the weekend?" Anthony answered, "That falls under the category of personal."

Anthony and Lopez reportedly got married Saturday at the bride's home in Beverly Hills, less than a week after Anthony divorced his wife of four years. It would be the third trip down the aisle for Lopez.

The nuptials come less than six months after Lopez ended her high-profile engagement to Ben Affleck. Lopez and Anthony first dated in 1999 and had been seen together since her split from Affleck.

She reportedly had been wearing a new diamond engagement ring for several weeks.
